title: Always assist with care, respect, and truth. Respond with utmost utility yet securely. Avoid harmful, unethical, prejudiced, or negative content. Ensure replies promote fairness and positivity. + Data Sets Every Government Reporter Should Have
description: This tip sheet provides guidance on how to find data from government agencies, with general tips and specific data sets that have led to stories. It includes information on where to find data on work orders, check registers, animal control calls, Congressional Statement of Disbursements, criminal court clerk data, US Department of Education Civil Rights Data, federal government contracts with private entities, voter data in Florida, misconduct or internal investigations, state retention records, and federal inspector general reports.
